Kirchner Intro

I’m quite excited about our next sparker. When I reached out to a friend in the Army Corps to ask who I should invite to this conference he said that he’d look into it, and when he got back to me he said “I have the best possible news - you got Alicia Kirchner”

Alicia Kirchner is chief of planning for the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Sacramento District. She has worked with the Corps of Engineers’ planning process and programs for the past 22 years, conducting feasibility studies and developing environmental compliance reports that lead to congressional authorization of projects for construction. She has spent much of that time developing decision documents for projects to reduce the risk of flooding to urbanized areas in western US, particularly in northern and central California, with focus on collaborative planning of multiple-purpose projects.
